concise_definition: n. 角落, 转角, 有利位置, 困境

definitions.explanation_en: The point or area where two edges or sides meet, especially at an angle, such as the intersection of two walls or the outer edge of a room.
definitions.explanation_cn: 两条边或面相交形成的点或区域，通常呈角度，例如两面墙的交界处或房间的外角。
definitions.example_en: She hung the painting in the corner of the living room.
definitions.example_cn: 她把画挂在了客厅的角落里。

definitions.explanation_en: A secluded or remote place, often used metaphorically to describe a hidden or less accessible area.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一个偏僻或隐秘的地方，常用于比喻指难以触及或被忽视的区域。
definitions.example_en: The old bookstore was tucked away in a quiet corner of the city.
definitions.example_cn: 那家旧书店藏在城市一个安静的角落里。

definitions.explanation_en: A position of advantage or control, especially in business or negotiation, where one party has leverage or the upper hand.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种优势地位或控制权，尤其在商业或谈判中，指一方拥有主动权或优势。
definitions.example_en: The company has cornered the market on electric vehicle batteries.
definitions.example_cn: 这家公司已垄断了电动汽车电池市场。

definitions.explanation_en: A difficult or inescapable situation, often used in the phrase 'to be backed into a corner' to describe being forced into a tight or desperate position.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种困难或无法逃脱的处境，常用于短语 '被逼入绝境'，形容被迫陷入窘迫或绝望的境地。
definitions.example_en: After the scandal broke, the politician was cornered by reporters and had no good answers.
definitions.example_cn: 丑闻曝光后，这位政客被记者围堵，无言以对。

comparison.analysis: “Angle” (角度) 侧重于几何或方向上的倾斜度，强调两条线或面之间的夹角，常用于数学、设计或摄影语境。而 “corner” 更强调空间中的交汇点或区域，具有物理存在感和位置属性。
“Nook” (角落/凹处) 指一个较小、舒适、隐蔽的角落，常带有温馨或休闲的联想，如阅读角。它比 “corner” 更具情感色彩和私密性，通常用于描述宜人的空间，而非中性或对抗性的位置。
“Edge” (边缘) 指物体或区域的边界线，强调的是界限而非交汇点。例如，桌子的边缘、悬崖的边缘。而 “corner” 是两条边缘相交形成的点或区域，具有更强的结构性和空间定位特征。
